result.execSummary:
The defendant Jovan A Caraballo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Sentence credit of 1 day is granted if revoked.
-Court will allow early termination after 6-months if agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: -Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-No dangerous weapons.
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovan A Caraballo

records.addlTxt:
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Abigail Broze 
**Clerk inboxed to BC on 10-20-2022**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 3:50 p.m.
Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Jovan A Caraballo.  
Defendant Jovan A Caraballo in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
30-Days Jail
Credit time 1-Day, if Revoked
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
Court will allow early termination after 6-Months if Agent deems it appropriate
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

Court orders that the firearm is to be forfeited.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Jovan A Caraballo on 22CM0588.
Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court as friend of the Court for Jovan A Caraballo on 22TR2176 and 22TR2177. 
Defendant Jovan A Caraballo in court.  
Attorney Broze requests a different date for plea/sentencing.  Court grants.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:27 AM   File not called on the record.
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jovan A Caraballo in court by zoom with attorney Abigail Broze as a friend of the Court.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Attorney Broze requests a plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing May 15, 2022. (BC)

records.addlTxt:
09:44 AM Defendant Jovan A Caraballo in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing May 15, 2022.  The Court orders the Defendant to go to the Business Center (Rm. 112) right after court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
